BILAWS OF THE NYSERTA (Continued)
3
SECTION B: Nominations: Prior to the Spring meeting of the Association,
the President of the Association shall appoint a nominating committee
to present to such meeting nominations for the Trustees to be elected
at the Spring meeting.
SECTION C: Duties: The Board of Trustees shall manage the funds, affairs,
and property of the Association. They shall have full power and it
shall be their duty to carry out the purposes of the Association as
set forth in the Charter.
SECTION D: Quorum: A quorum shall consist of a majority of the members
of the Board
SECTION E: Resignation: If any Trustee shall fail to attend three consecu¬
tive meetings without excuse accepted as satisfactory by the Board, he
shall be deemed to have resigned.
SECTION F: Committees: All Board committees shall be established to run
for the year following the Spring meeting of the Association. The
President shall appoint these committees.
SECTION G: Officers: The Board of Trustees shall elect from the members
of such Board, such officers of the Board as they may deem necessary.
SECTION H: The Board of Trustees shall meet from time to time on call of
the President or any three members of the Board.
SECTION I: The Board shall adopt its own rules and procedures for conduct¬
ing business.
ARTICLE VI
BUDGET
The annual budget of the New York State Educational Radio and Television
Association shall be approved by the Board of Trustees, the costs to be
prorated among the members.
ARTICLE VII
STEERING COMMITTEE
The Board of Trustees shall appoint a Steering Committee of not fewer
than three (3) nor more than fifteen (l£) from among the membership to
execute the purposes and related functions of the New York State
Educational Radio and Television Association within the limits and policies
established by the Board of Trustees. The Officers of the Association
shall be the Officers of the Steering Committee.
